FAQ.question: WHAT IS A HACKATHON?
FAQ.answer: A hackathon is a programming competition in which competitors use technology to build innovative projects within 36 hours. There will be opportunities to win cool prizes, learn from our key-note speakers, and network with our sponsors.

FAQ.question: WHERE IT WILL BE HOSTED?
FAQ.answer: Hack the mountains 2.0 will be hosted in APRIL, 2020, completely virtually. All you need is to create a Slack account to communicate with our Hack the mountains community.

FAQ.question: IS IT FREE OF COST?
FAQ.answer: Hack the mountains 2.0 is absolutely free of cost to participate.

FAQ.question: I AM A BEGINNER. AM I ELIGIBILE TO PARTICIPATE?
FAQ.answer: Yes, this is open to all the people. We would love to have your participation.

FAQ.question: ARE THERE ANY RULES ?
FAQ.answer: Attendees must abide by the MLH Code of Conduct. We want to respect each other and keep Hack the mountains a safe environment for all participants.

FAQ.question: WHO CAN PARTICIPATE ?
FAQ.answer: Everyone can participate! We encourage anyone who is interested in learning more about Hackathons, programming, and the tech industry to join Hack the Mountains!

FAQ.question: CAN I VOLUNTEER OR BE JUDGE ?
FAQ.answer: Yes! Hack the Mountains wouldn't be possible without our volunteers. We will open mentor and judge sign ups soon, and you can get notified when it opens up.

FAQ.question: WHAT ARE THE PRIZES FOR WINNERS ?
What is Duration for the Hackathon?
FAQ.answer: Hack The Mountains is 36 hours online hackathon

FAQ.question: How many Members can be  in a Team ?
FAQ.answer: A team consists of 2-5 members. You can also take part solo in this hackathon as well.
